About Me

Here are some things about me...

BIO

I am an Electrical Engineering graduate from the University of Alberta. I have just recently completed my MSc. in Signals and Image Processing, and I am now in the process of looking to apply my skills. I have a strong passion for web development, and I am constantly looking to upgrade my skills. I am working towards becoming a full stack developer. With the programming skills I've honed over the years in my undergraduate and graduate classes, along with my increasing knowledge of web development, I want to create enagaging, intuitive, and elegant designs and applications that work with the user to accomplish any task.

Phrasing! Ltd

Web Developer

I worked as a web developer for a company that was developing a stock tracking and management system. The application was built using CakePHP, and MySQL. Working with a small team, I worked on adding new features to the site, including incorporating caching use Memcached to improve speed of queries. I was also worked on creating new styling, and fixing styling issues.

University of Alberta

Developer and Researcher

As part of my Master's program at the University of Alberta, in the faculty of Electrical and Computer Engineering, I developed novel algorithms to perform colour operations on images captured by nonlinear image sensors. I developed an algorithm to perform colour correction, and an algorithm to perform demosaicking on images containing Salt-and-Pepper noise. Additionally, I developed the infrastructure required to test and validate both algorithms. I was able to publish a conference proceeding about my results in the Journal of Imaging Science and Technology.
